required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Everolimus-containing Chemotherapy in HER2- mBC Patients With PI3K/AKT/mTOR Mutations Study
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Everolimus-containing Chemotherapy in HER2 Negative Metastatic Breast Cancer Patients With PI3K/AKT/mTOR Mutations: A Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study aimed to investigate the efficacy of the everolimus-containing chemotherapy in metastatic breast cancer patients with PI3K/AKT/mTOR mutations.14 cases of HER2- metastatic breast cancer patients with PI3K/AKT/mTOR mutations treated with everolimus-containing chemotherapy were retrospectively analyzed.The genetic profile in PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway was studied.

detailed_description.textblock:
The PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway is frequently altered in breast cancer. Everolimus is a selective inhibitor of mammalian target of Rapamycin (mTOR).The benefit of everolimus in metastatic breast cancer patients with PI3K/AKT/mTOR mutations remains unclear, especially in TNBC patients. The study aimed to investigate the efficacy of the everolimus-containing chemotherapy in metastatic breast cancer patients with PI3K/AKT/mTOR mutations.
14 cases of HER2- metastatic breast cancer participants with PI3K/AKT/mTOR mutations treated with everolimus-containing chemotherapy were retrospectively analyzed.The genetic profile in PI3K/AKT/mTOR pathway was studied.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The PFS was defined as the interval from the date of taking the everolimus-containing chemotherapy to the date of the first occurrence of disease progression or death from any cause,whichever came first, assessed up to 24 months.

intervention.intervention_name: No intervention, it was a retrospective study.
intervention.description: This study aimed to retrospectively investigate the efficacy of the everolimus-containing chemotherapy in metastatic breast cancer patients with PI3K/AKT/mTOR mutations.There was no intervention.

study_pop.textblock: HER2- metastatic breast cancer patients with PI3K/AKT/mTOR mutations treated with everolimus-containing chemotherapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with HER2- metastatic breast cancer
2. Patients with PI3K/AKT/mTOR mutation
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients treated with endocrinotherapy and everolimus.
2. The efficacy evaluation could not be available.
